message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.CVPR

This paper proposes a novel representation for dense pixel-wise estimation tasks using CNNs, specifically for the challenging problem of optical flow estimation. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also introduces a new network architecture and discusses the benefits of joint estimation, which suggests that it could also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the problem of optical flow estimation is closely related to robotics and autonomous systems, which could make sub-categories such as cs.RO (Robotics) relevant as well. Finally, the paper was presented at the Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR), which further supports the relevance to cs.CVPR.
